title: Understanding Repetitive Behaviors
text: Repetitive and stereotyped behaviors are actions that are repeated in the same way over time. These behaviors can be physical or verbal.

title: Examples of Repetitive Behaviors
text: Think about actions that are done repeatedly without any specific purpose, like moving a part of the body in a certain way or saying the same word over and over.

hintAnswer: hand flapping, body rocking, repeating words, or placing toys in the same order all the time
title: Identifying Repetitive Behaviors
text: Which of the following is an example of a repetitive and stereotyped behavior?
choices: where an individual is unable to control their feelings and emotions
hand flapping, body rocking, repeating words, or placing toys in the same order all the time
difficulty paying attention, difficulty controlling impulsive behaviors, or excessive activity
